title: American_Top_40_1978_December_9th
description:
"Every week on AT40 we count down the biggest hits in the USA from Buffalo to Caribou; from Deer Park to Elk Ridge. At number 24 here's Dan Fogelberg and Tim Weisberg, "The Power Of Gold."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

This is the last three hours of a four hour show. I supplied the ten missing songs. If you don't want to play them, skip all the files that start with double zero.

In this broadcast:

Casey calls one singer-songwriter in the countdown the most successful recording act since The Beatles.

Since Andy Gibb's first three singles went to number one, a listener wants to know if any acts have ever had their first three albums go to number one. Casey says three acts have had their first FOUR albums hit number one, and gives the details.

There is a hit by the artist who was the first solo artist ever to have three separate singles from the same album on the hot 100 all at the same time.

The brand new number one song this week is "Le Freak" by Chic, making them only the second group ever to hit number one on the Pop, Soul, and Disco charts with the same song at the same time.
